metadata.Title: CVE-2021-32551 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
It was discovered that read_file() in apport/hookutils.py would follow symbolic links or open FIFOs. When this function is used by the openjdk-15 package apport hooks, it could expose private data to other local users.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-32551` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu67
apport-gtk - 2.20.11-0ubuntu67
apport-kde - 2.20.11-0ubuntu67
apport-noui - 2.20.11-0ubuntu67
apport-retrace - 2.20.11-0ubuntu67
apport-valgrind - 2.20.11-0ubuntu67
dh-apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu67
python3-apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu67
python3-problem-report - 2.20.11-0ubuntu67
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apport package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.20.11-0ubuntu67').
